Brands That Work with Micro Influencers: Your Guide to Landing Your First Deal as a New Creator

You've hit 1,000 or maybe 10,000 followers—congrats, you're officially a micro-influencer! With influencer marketing projected to reach $24.1 billion by 2025 (Forbes, 2025), brands are eager to partner with creators like you who have engaged, niche audiences. Micro-influencers (1K–100K followers) boast 6–17% engagement rates, far outpacing mega-influencers (Influencer Marketing Hub, 2024). This guide shows you why brands love micro-influencers, which ones are open to new creators, and how to land your first paid deal with Newcollab.

Your First Brand Deal Awaits

Connect with 1,000+ brands seeking micro-influencers on Newcollab.

Publish your ad offers

Why Brands Love Micro-Influencers

Brands are shifting away from mega-influencers because creators with 1K–10K followers offer unique advantages:

  • High Engagement: Micro-influencers average 6% engagement on Instagram and 17% on TikTok, vs. 1–2% for mega-influencers (Influencer Marketing Hub, 2024). Your likes, comments, and shares signal a loyal audience.
  • Authenticity: 92% of consumers trust peer recommendations over brands (Nielsen, 2024). Your relatable content feels like a friend's advice.
  • Niche Audiences: Your focus (e.g., vegan recipes, budget fashion) attracts brands targeting specific demographics.
  • Cost-Effective: Brands pay $10–$100 per post for 1K–10K followers, making you a budget-friendly choice (eMarketer, 2024).

Top Brands That Work with Micro-Influencers

These brands actively partner with creators starting at 1K followers, perfect for new micro-influencers:

1. Thrive Market

Niche: Health, Wellness, Organic Food
Platform: Instagram, TikTok
Why They Love Micro-Influencers: Thrive Market seeks creators who share their passion for sustainable, healthy living. They offer affiliate programs (5–10% commissions) and product gifting for posts.

  • How to Pitch: Post a recipe using their products, tag @thrivemarket, and use #ThriveTribe. Join their affiliate program via Newcollab.
  • Example: A vegan creator with 3K followers earned $200 for a TikTok recipe video.

2. Mejuri

Niche: Fashion, Jewelry
Platform: Instagram, TikTok
Why They Love Micro-Influencers: Mejuri collaborates with creators for authentic styling content, offering free jewelry or $50–$200 per post.

  • How to Pitch: Share an #OOTD featuring their jewelry, tag @mejuri, and apply via their creator program on Newcollab.
  • Example: A fashion creator with 5K followers got a $150 deal for an Instagram Reel.

3. Book of the Month

Niche: Books, Lifestyle
Platform: Instagram, YouTube
Why They Love Micro-Influencers: They partner with book lovers (1K+ followers) for reviews and unboxings, offering free subscriptions or $50–$100 per post.

  • How to Pitch: Post a book review, tag @bookofthemonth, and use #BOTM. Reach out via Newcollab's messaging tools.

4. Ana Luisa

Niche: Jewelry, Sustainability
Platform: Instagram, YouTube
Why They Love Micro-Influencers: Ana Luisa values authentic storytelling, offering $50–$200 per post or free products for creators with 1K+ followers.

  • How to Pitch: Create a styling video, tag @analuisany, and pitch via Newcollab's dashboard.

5. Frank Body

Niche: Beauty, Skincare
Platform: Instagram, TikTok
Why They Love Micro-Influencers: Frank Body's #frankeffect campaign encourages creators to share authentic skincare routines, offering free products or $100–$300 per post.

  • How to Pitch: Post a skincare routine, tag @frank_bod, and use #frankeffect. Connect via Newcollab.

How to Land Your First Brand Deal

Follow these steps to turn your 1K–10K followers into paid partnerships:

  1. Define Your Niche: Focus on a specific passion (e.g., fitness, books) to attract brands like those in our brands looking for ambassadors guide.
  2. Optimize Your Profile: Use a clear bio (e.g., 'Budget Fashion Enthusiast') and high-quality visuals.
  3. Engage Your Audience: Respond to comments and DMs to boost your 6–17% engagement rate.
  4. Create a Media Kit: Highlight your audience demographics, 800–1,200 likes per post, and niche content. Newcollab offers free media kit templates.
  5. Pitch Brands: Use Newcollab's bidding tools to pitch brands like Thrive Market, offering $10–$100 per post.
  6. Post Authentic Content: Share reviews of products you love, tagging brands to get noticed.
  7. Join Newcollab: Access 1,000+ brands and manage deals with fast payouts via Stripe Connect.

Check out our guide on how to get sponsored by brands for more tips.

Tips for Standing Out

  • Use Hashtags: Brands like Frank Body monitor #frankeffect. Research brand-specific hashtags on Instagram or TikTok.
  • Showcase Engagement: Highlight your 800–1,200 likes per post and 1K–1.2K story views in pitches.
  • Be Authentic: Promote products you use to build trust, like a creator who rejected a $100 deal for an inauthentic fit.
  • Leverage Newcollab: Use our analytics to track performance and prove ROI to brands.

Conclusion

Micro-influencers with 1K–10K followers are in high demand for their authenticity and engagement. Brands like Thrive Market and Mejuri are eager to work with new creators like you. With Newcollab, pitch your first deal and earn $10–$300 per post. Explore our micro-influencer brand guide to kickstart your journey.

faq.question: What are micro-influencers?
faq.answer: Micro-influencers are creators with 1K–100K followers, known for high engagement rates (6–17%) and niche audiences. They offer authentic, relatable content that brands value for targeted marketing campaigns.

faq.question: How many followers do I need to work with brands?
faq.answer: Just 1K followers with 6%+ engagement can land brand deals, especially via platforms like Newcollab. Brands value quality engagement over follower count, making micro-influencers highly sought after.

faq.question: How much can I earn as a new micro-influencer?
faq.answer: New micro-influencers typically earn $10–$100 per post, with top deals reaching $300. Earnings increase with engagement rates, niche focus, and content quality. Newcollab helps creators set competitive rates.

faq.question: How do I find brands to work with?
faq.answer: Join Newcollab to connect with 1,000+ brands actively seeking micro-influencers. You can also tag brands like @mejuri in authentic posts, use brand-specific hashtags, and apply to creator programs directly.

faq.question: What should I include in my brand pitch?
faq.answer: Include your follower count, engagement rate (6%+), audience demographics, content examples, and specific reasons why you're a good fit for the brand. Newcollab provides templates and bidding tools to streamline the process.
